alert.note: Alert for Greenville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 4:41AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Central and southern Greenville County, South Carolina, including the Greenville metropolitan area. * WHEN...Until 645 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to drainages and streams including parks and greenways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 441 AM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - While the Reedy River appears to have crested in the City of Greenville, the Reedy at Highway 418 near Fork Shoals continues to rise. High flows also continue along Brushy and Gilder creeks feeding the Enoree River as well, with Gilder Creek still rising where it crosses Georgia Rd. Isolated out- of-bank conditions are possible, flooding wooded and undeveloped areas. Also, backwater effects may flood Marler Rd near Dunklin Bridge Rd near Gray Court. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenville, Greer, Mauldin, Taylors, Simpsonville, Berea, Five Forks, Fountain Inn, Welcome, Powdersville, Piedmont, Donaldson Center, GSP Airport, Fork Shoals and Princeton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
